document_name: PRODOC-Emergency Response for Earthquake in Shan State.pdf
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/MMR/00013948/PRODOC-Emergency Response for Earthquake in Shan State.pdf

donor_name: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
outputs.output_descr: Village community groups strengthened to implement village development priorities

Restoring livelihoods following Cyclone Nargis and helping people start rebuilding their lives are at the heart of this project. Year one is focused on quick impact activities that resuscitate the village economy in 500 villages. Year two will focus on moving towards more sustainable livelihoods in 750 villages through an integrated approach to early recovery at the community level. A variety of assistance (conditional direct financial support for livelihoods, in-kind support, support for community works) will be delivered through community-based organizations. Sectoral support (health, environment, education, and shelter) will be delivered through the same CBOs to reinforce and improve livelihoods. The project places a special emphasis on the most vulnerable households  female and single male parent headed households, orphaned children, landless and casual labourers, the elderly alone and people with disability  and will provide them a differentiated package of support. The project is designed to benefit equally women and men, however, attention to women's special needs will be taken into consideration and addressed. Reducing disaster risk and enhancing community-based disaster preparedness is a cornerstone of this project.
Post-Nargis Recovery & Preparedness Plan (PONREPP) Support to Co-ordination Arrangements

Output#1: Promoting inter-agency coordination to enhance information sharing and advocacy on DRR at different level. 	
Output#2: Risk assessments and documentation of good practices for improving DRR programming 
Output#3: Promoting Mainstreaming DRR into livelihood-focused programmes
Output#4: Supporting Communities for disaster resilience
Restoration of the environment stability of the Inle Lake with the improvement of the quality of life of local communities.
Supporting on the programme implementation of the HDI projects activities effectively as well as for coordinating with Government to formulate the new Country Programme (2013-2015) smoothly.
88 houses completely constructed and provided to requested needy earthquake affected households in Tachileik, Shan State
